title: What is an example of a directed and undirected graph? - Quora

response.answer_text: A directed graph only flows one way between nodes. One example is rivers merging and splitting over a landscape. They aren't going to flow backwards. An undirected graph example is a graph of academic collaborations on papers. If you share a paper with person X, they share a paper with you by default. There aren't one-way relationships.

A good example of a directed graph is Twitter or Instagram. You can follow a person but it doesn’t mean that the respective person is following you back. You have a connection to them, they don’t have a connection to you. An undirected graph is Facebook. You befriend a person and you both become friends. It’s both ways: you can see his/her posts, they can see yours.
